body: @fonnesbeck what commit were you at b4 you updated?
The version number on the egg that I created is 0.13.1_213_gc174c3d, if that is helpful.
yep that last bit is commit c9df3d4
Sorry, I made a mistake in the version number -- corrected above.
hm actually that's a very recent commit i suspect it was older
Did you see my correction to the version number?
oh sorry i didn't refresh the page :)
what's the structure of your frame so i can create a test
actually nvm i'll figure it out

hm i get this oddity when i run

```
In [6]: df = DataFrame({'g': np.random.choice(['m','f','u'], size=100), 'age': rand(100) * 100})

In [7]: df.groupby('g').boxplot(column='age')
```

![test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/417981/2959097/b4a7bbd2-daaf-11e3-82f7-3f8efabfc112.png)

@fonnesbeck do you install with `python setup.py develop` or `python setup.py install`? in the error message it looks like the egg has the same commit tag but you said you've updated to master? does that matter?

I'm always installing using an egg rather than `develop`. Here is the structure of the df:

```
list(articulation_dataset.groupby('bimodal'))[0]
```

@cpcloud  your plot may not actually be blank. There was a matplotlib bug with boxplot that didn't set the `lim`s correctly. Play around with setting them.

![bp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1312546/2959354/0665ac5c-dab2-11e3-8c14-e89f42c3240e.png)

@fonnesbeck this works for me on master:

```
In [20]: df = DataFrame({'bimodal': rand(100) > 0.5, 'age': randint(2, 80, size=100)})

In [21]: df.groupby('bimodal').boxplot(column='age')
```

i've had strange things occur in the past when i've installed with `python setup.py install` multiple times.

can you try

(from within the pandas directory)

``` sh
pip uninstall pandas --yes # keep doing this until it throws an error if you have multiple eggs laying around
python setup.py develop
```

and then try your boxplot again? sorry to make you jump through hoops .... 

@TomAugspurger awesome thanks!
